key_responsibilities: advising the Member on all matters in the issue portfolio
developing and advancing policy proposals
drafting vote recommendations and talking points for related floor and committee proceedings
staffing the Member in relevant meetings
representing the Member before constituents and stakeholders

prior legislative experience advising a Member of Congress and advancing policy proposals
excellent written and verbal communication skills
eagerness to work in a fast-paced, collaborative office

key_responsibilities: drafting constituent letters
sorting and batching mail
assisting the legislative staff with various projects
requirements: ability to manage multiple tasks at once

key_responsibilities: Interviewing or deposing witnesses
Providing legal analysis and advice
Reviewing and drafting legislation

Preparing for full and subcommittee hearings
Supporting other counsel in the office
Briefing committee members and staff
requirements: JD from an accredited law school
minimum of 1-3 years litigation or investigative experience
ability to multi-task and keep up in a fast-paced office

researching casework matters that arise
communicating frequently with local stakeholders and constituents
providing front office operational support including welcoming visitors, sorting mail and answering phones
special casework initiatives as required
representing the Member and Office at community events and meetings
assisting with office outreach initiatives
scheduling meetings and events

working with internal and external stakeholders to maximize time efficiency

assisting with Member’s personal correspondence

creating daily social media and video content
tracking press clips and traffic on social media
drafting press releases, op-eds, newsletters, and video scripts

clipping TV interviews, floor speeches, and committee hearings
tracking newsletter, social media metrics, and supporting communications team as necessary

monitoring the flow of incoming and outgoing mail
keeping the constituent database complete and current
responding to all constituent correspondence in a timely manner
managing intern correspondence work
researching legislative issues
working with the legislative and communications staff to maintain a proactive constituent outreach operation
drafting proactive communication to constituents

key_responsibilities: working with the Outreach Director to engage with a broad range of stakeholders throughout Illinois’ 14th Congressional District
planning and staffing public events like informational workshops, roundtables, community forums, and site visits designed to highlight the priorities of residents of the District
writing for liaising with stakeholders and drafting briefing memos and letters
proactive communication skills that strengthen teamwork
attention to detail and project management skills
managing multiple deadline-driven projects
providing a high volume of ethics advice, education, and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee
employment law, including the laws governing sexual harassment in the workplace

responding to invitations for DC meetings and events
communicating with the District team about invitations for District events
managing the travel plans and logistics
preparing meeting briefs and binders for all meetings and events in DC
maintaining a weekly schedule that balances the Member's official and unofficial time in DC
working with the Chief of Staff to review schedule requests
processing vouchers for travel and expense reimbursement for the Member and staff
overseeing and assisting the Staff Assistant as needed with answering the phone, greeting visitors, and managing the intern program
additional duties related to managing the overall operation of the DC office
supporting the legislative team as needed
requirements: experience with managing constituent mail systems
ability to perform well in a fast pace work environment

key_responsibilities: representing and promoting the Office of Congressman Greg Steube at events in the community
serving as a liaison between the Congressman and various community stakeholders
monitoring and updating the Member and District Director on district and local issues
answering casework correspondence and verbal communications with constituents
acting as liaison with federal, district, and local agencies for the Member and constituents
staffing Sebring, FL Congressional District Office Monday – Friday (9AM – 5PM) unless conducting outreach
attending community events and traveling throughout the district at regular intervals representing Congressman Steube
informing the Member and the District Director of all happenings in his or her assigned issue areas
acting as liaison and interfacing with city, county, district, and federal officials
assisting local governments, non-profits, and constituents in obtaining federal funding opportunities
assessing casework for problems requiring legislative action and making recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff
meeting with constituents regarding general policy matters
handling intake of casework, logging incoming and outgoing correspondence, handling visitors, and telephone calls
serving as office manager – POC for IT equipment, furniture, and office supplies in Sebring
other duties as assigned
requirements: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university
strong oral and written communication skills
knowledge of all issues and events in the district in which the Member is involved
thoroughness and careful attention to detail
skill in organizing and prioritizing work tasks and activities
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in fulfillment of outreach responsibilities
ability to coordinate public outreach events
ability to work nights and weekends

developing talking points, speeches, and press releases

working collaboratively with Iowa and national team members on all aspects of the office
facilitating successful events and earned media in the district

ability to work in a fast-paced environment
ability to execute a communications plan

key_responsibilities: overseeing the office’s legislative operation and staff
providing vote and cosponsorship recommendations to the member

working knowledge of environmental and veterans/military issues
strong understanding of politics and the intersection of politics and policy
